results.title: Dance with a stranger
results.creator_credit: Mike Newell, Roger Randall-Cutler and First Film Company
results.brief_description: The story of Ruth Ellis, a woman tortured by her love for a cruel man who demanded and took from her more than she could possibly give. Her only escape was to rid herself of the terrible pain he caused, so she shot him dead in cold blood. She was convicted of murder and became the last woman in England to be hanged. Starring Miranda Richardson, Rupert Everett and Ian Holm.

results.title: Jan Svankmajer. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Jan Svankmajer, Argos and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Jan Svankmajer’s animation is witty, macabre, violent, and always perverse in its bizarre transformations of objects and beings. His films have spawned many imitations in television advertising, music video and has inspired fellow animators. This video contains a retrospective collection of his short films. “Jabberwocky” interprets Lewis Carroll’s verse as a last magical adventure before adulthood; “J.S. Bach: fantasia in G minor” probes the mystery of the real with the great composer’s help; domestic mayhem is on the menu in “Punch and Judy”; while “Leonardo’s diary” transports the renaissance polymath to the twentieth century; “The Ossuary” tours the ultimate bone-yard, a monument to the Black Death; and in “The Death of Stalinism in Bohemia” Svankmajer hammers an animated nail in the coffin of Czech communism.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jan Svankmajer, Argos and British Film Institute

results.title: Jamon jamon [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jose Bigas Luna, Andres Gomes, Lola Films and Ovideo TV
results.brief_description: Bigas Luna co-wrote and directed “Jamon jamon”, which stars Penelope Cruz and Javier Bardem, both Spanish actors who would go on to achieve fame in America. “Jamon jamon” is a comedy/drama set in the arid region of Monegros, Spain. Jose Luis is a young executive working in an underwear factory, run by his overbearing mother and passive father. Luis is having a relationship with a factory girl Silvia (Cruz) who is pregnant with his child. Jose’s mother Conchita, is horrified by the thought of her son marrying anyone at all, let alone a factory worker whose mother is a prostitute. Conchita sets about scuttling her son’s plans by hiring Raul, a handsome would be bullfighter to woo Silvia. Complications ensue all round as Conchita takes a liking to Raul herself and Jose cannot pass up his fondness for sleeping with Silvia’s mother (who also has a past history with Jose’s father). “Jamon jamon” is a film about sex, love, infidelity, passion, loyalty and family. Heavy symbolism reflects a macho culture driven by male desire for assuaging of ego and ratification of sexual prowess. Features numerous erotic heterosexual scenes. Winner of the Silver Lion at the 1992 Venice Film Festival.

results.title: Jamie Oliver: Pukka tukka
results.creator_credit: Brian Klein, Jamie Oliver and Video Collection International
results.brief_description: Naked chef Jamie Oliver challenges the notion that fast food is easier and cheaper than any pucker tucker. Pitting his culinary skills against leading brands of instant meals, he creates his own variations on pasta, salmon, and an apple and blackberry crumble to prove that he comes in quicker and cheaper with home variations. Jamie also finds time to drop in on friends with a variety of backgrounds and budgets, in Coventry, Manchester and London and creates a range of dishes including: slow-roasted leg of pork with spicy scratching; sticky chocolate sauce pudding; celeriac and potato gratin; tray baked field mushrooms with garlic, butter and thyme; apricot and pistachio tarte tatin; sea bass with fennel and olives; white risotto with lemon thyme, sliced prosciutto, pecorino, parmesan and crumbled goats cheese. He also outlines the vital ingredients of a pantry.

results.title: Jamie, Ethan and Keir: 2-14 months
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Child”.
The world at toddler’s eye level. For months a baby lies in his crib looking at all those things just beyond his reach. Then he learns to move about, to crawl, to stand and suddenly all those things are his to touch, to taste. This film observes a baby’s natural curiosity, his way of “getting into things” as part of the experience of learning and adapting. Differences in behaviour of the three babies are noted.

results.title: James Dean: the rare movies
results.creator_credit: Don Medford, Justis Addiss, Martin Horrell, Mort Abrahams, William Self, Management Corporation of America and Meridan
results.brief_description: These three teleplays, produced in 1953, 1954 and 1955 display James Dean’s mastery of playing the young angst-ridden loner who longs for a better life for himself. “Something for an empty briefcase”: A young drifter and ex-jailbird pines to be a respectable gentleman in life, the type who carries a briefcase to work, instead of a thief. One night he meets a young dancer who displays to him that it is possible to live with passion for life, not just for money. “The unlighted road”: Jeffrey is an ex-army serviceman drifting from small town to small town hoping to find a connection somewhere or with something. One night he is offered a job in a diner but suspects foul play amidst some of the more seedy customers. When Jeffrey falls for a local girl, their future together is threatened by his boss’ dodgy dealings. “I’m a fool”: an older man laments his youthful folly when as a simple farm boy he put on false airs and graces in order to win the attention of the lovely and sophisticated Lucy. Also stars: Natalie Wood. All three short films retain the advertisements from the show’s sponsor inserted at intermission.

results.title: Monkeys, apes and man: exploring the chasm
results.creator_credit: Jeff Myrow, National Geographic Society and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description: Explains how studies of primate social organisation, use and manufacture of tools, ability to learn, and socialisation, have shown that the similarity between monkeys and humans is not superficial.

results.title: Montgomery Clift: the prince
results.creator_credit: Claudio Masenza, Donatella Baglivo and Ciak Studio
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood’s rebels”.
A documentary incorporating footage of Montgomery Clift’s most memorable films; interviews with family and with friends of Clift (including Jane Fonda); and rare archival material stretching back to his childhood. What develops is the story of an intense young boy who yearned for stardom, achieved notable success in such classic films as “From Here to Eternity” and “I Confess”, only to be ruined by alcohol addiction and his inability to face his own fears and homosexual desires. Montgomery Clift, as this video portrays him, may have not been a happy man but he never compromised his acting talents for Hollywood.

results.title: James Dean
results.creator_credit: Claudio Masenza, Donatella Baglivo and Ciak Studio
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood’s rebels”.
James Dean was a 1950s icon whose image fought against all that was wrong with the adult world: displacement of the young, repression, and general uncoolness. This documentary however focuses on James Dean the man, rather than his image. It is an illuminating look at the actor’s life seen through the eyes of friends, family and work colleagues. The testimonials are frank and thought provoking, and there is rare footage of TV commercials and telemovies that Dean had featured in. It shows an extremely talented and ambitious actor who often seemed more comfortable on stage or in front of a camera than he did being himself. Refreshingly it also highlights other sides to Dean such as his wicked sense of humour. The interviewees speak candidly and articulately of stories that are not a staple of the James Dean myth, leaving one with a real sense of whom this young man was as an actor.
